summary: This is an email chain from December 21, 2020, among Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing a judicial order from Judge Engelmayer. The judge has requested a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) declaration to explain the significant disparities in discovery review and counsel access accommodations between two detained defendants: Ghislaine Maxwell (held at MDC) and Justin Rivera (held at MCC). The email details the differences in their housing situations and the accommodations provided, and notes the judge's concern about the optics of the disparity.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The co-defendant in a sex trafficking case, detained at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) outside general population. The email details the extensive accommodations she receives for discovery review and counsel visits.

persons.name: Justin Rivera
persons.context: Defendant in a separate sex trafficking conspiracy case, detained at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in general population. The email discusses the court's frustration with the MCC's provision of accommodations for his case preparation compared to Maxwell.

persons.name: Judge Engelmayer
persons.context: The judge presiding over United States v. Rivera et al. He expressed frustration with the MCC's treatment of Rivera and ordered a BOP declaration to explain the disparity in accommodations between Rivera and Maxwell.

connections.description: Both are defendants in separate federal sex trafficking cases before the same district court (SDNY). They are connected in this document due to a judicial comparison of the accommodations provided to them while in pre-trial detention.
Judge Engelmayer is the presiding judge in Rivera's case and has issued orders and expressed concern regarding Rivera's access to discovery and counsel while detained.

Judge Engelmayer is referenced in relation to Maxwell's case due to his order requiring an explanation for the disparity in accommodations she receives compared to Rivera, implicating her detention conditions.

events.title: Court Conference on Rivera Accommodations
events.description: A court conference was held before Judge Engelmayer regarding Justin Rivera's access to discovery and counsel. Defense counsel cited the superior accommodations given to Ghislaine Maxwell, and the judge ordered a BOP declaration to explain the disparity.

keyFacts: Judge Engelmayer ordered a BOP declaration to explain why accommodations for discovery and counsel access provided to Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC could not be extended to Justin Rivera at MCC.
The documented disparities are significant: Maxwell had 91 hours/week for electronic discovery review versus Rivera's 21 hours, and 15 hours/week for counsel video visits versus Rivera's 6 hours.
The defense counsel for Rivera suggested the disparity in treatment was due to race, gender, and class, which the judge acknowledged created 'terrible' optics.

The government's initial explanation for the disparity centered on the defendants' different housing situations: Maxwell was held outside general population at MDC, while Rivera was in general population at MCC.
The Maxwell investigation involved the seizure of over 60 devices and the entire FBI file from the prior Florida investigation, contributing to the 'enormous volumes' of discovery material.
